ALLEGATION:
It was reported there was COVID exposure at the facility. It was observed that
staff are not wearing masks appropriately.
2

INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed the reporting source. She said she made her monthly contact at Rose
Hall on September 18, 2020. She said she observed four staff, three were not
wearing masks and/or not wearing them appropriately. She said the male staff who
allowed her to sign into the building was not wearing a mask at all. She said the
male staff who walked her to the conference room only put his mask on once he saw
her but that the mask did not cover his nose. She said she observed a female staff
wearing her mask around her neck. She said this female staff pull her mask up to
cover her nose and mouth after she entered the hallway. She said she had received
an email on September 14, 2020 informing her that there was COVID exposure in
Rose Hall and that all staff and residents were being tested. She said upon her
arrival she was told that all of the residents were tested again prior to her arrival.
I interviewed Staff 1 regarding wearing a mask. She said she does not keep her
mask on for the entire shift. She said she wear the mask but sometimes she has to
take it off so that she could breath.
I interviewed Staff 2. She said she forgets sometimes to bring her mask in the
building and several times she entered the building without her mask. She said
mask are available for staff, on the medica cart if they forget their mask or leave it in
their cars. She said she was aware that a mask should be worn at all times.
I interviewed Staff 3. He reported he tries to wear the mask consistently but that he
does remove his mask sometimes.
All staff were consistent in stating they were aware of Vista Maria Policy of wearing a
mask in the building and on the grounds at all times.
I interviewed the Consumer Rights Officer. He said all staff were informed that a
mask should be worn at all times. He said he had observed staff not wearing mask
or not wearing them appropriately. He said the residents and staff at Rose Hall all
tested negative for COVID. He provided this Consultant with Vista Maria’s
procedure on Mask wearing. He also said the facility policy states (with the caveat
that if you are alone in your office/workstation you can remove your mask.)
Vista Maria procedure on Mask wearing states that the policy will remain in effect
until otherwise notified: “Employees are required to wear a mask that covers their
nose and mouth while on campus. Masks are meant to stop the wearer from
spreading respiratory droplets, remind people not to touch their faces and protect
you in instances where you come in contact with someone who is pre-symptomatic,
or has COVID-19 or has symptoms that have yet to be diagnosed. Employees
should continue to practice social distancing while wearing the mask. Masks must be
3

worn while on campus. This includes while you are walking between buildings or
within your building.”
I interviewed another DHHS Worker who was on campus on 10/09/2020. She said
all of the staff she observed in the building were not wearing masks. She said this
was not the first time she had observed the staff not wearing mask. She said several
of the staff were wearing their masks under their chins.
I observed three staff members not wearing mask in Beata Hall and Lourdes Hall. I
discuss mask wearing with the Consumer Rights Officer who said that mask are
available for the staff at all times and that they all know they should be wearing
masks.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, and discharge of residents.
ANALYSIS: After interviews, discussion and observation with the Consumer
Rights Office, DHHS Workers and staff members at Vista Maria
in different buildings, it was concluded that the facility staff are
not following Vista Maria policy and procedure regarding the
care of the residents and Mask wearing for staff.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Once an acceptable corrective action plan is received, I recommend Vista Maria –
Rose Hall continue its current licensing status.
